intro: Pleurothallis superposita, commonly known as the stacked pleurothallis, is a species of orchid native to the Andean regions of South America. It is a small, terrestrial orchid that typically grows in humid, shaded forest environments. The plant features delicate, linear leaves and produces tiny, fragrant flowers in shades of white and pink. It is known for its unique growth habit, with multiple stems growing from a single base. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
